dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S1947 RS: Government Publishing Office Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself and Mr. Chambliss) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration
Reported by Mr. Schumer, without amendment

form.official-title: To rename the Government Printing Office the Government Publishing Office, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Government Publishing Office Act of 2014.

section.header: Redesignation of Government Printing Office to Government Publishing Office

subsection.text: The Government Printing Office is hereby redesignated the Government Publishing Office.

Any reference to the Government Printing Office in any law, rule, regulation, certificate, directive, instruction, or other official paper in force on the date of enactment of this Act shall be considered to refer and apply to the Government Publishing Office.

section.header: Redesignation of Public Printer to Director of the Government Publishing Office

subsection.text: Title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Public Printer each place that term appears and inserting Director of the Government Publishing Office; and

in the heading for each of sections 301, 302, 303, 304, 305, 306, 307, 502, 710, 1102, 1111, 1115, 1340, 1701, 1712, and 1914, by striking Public Printer and inserting Director of the Government Publishing Office.

subsection.text: Any reference in any law other than in title 44, United States Code, or in any rule, regulation, certificate, directive, instruction, or other official paper in force on the date of enactment of this Act to the Public Printer shall be considered to refer and apply to the Director of the Government Publishing Office.

section.header: Redesignation of Deputy Public Printer to Deputy Director of the Government Publishing Office

subsection.text: Title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Deputy Public Printer each place that term appears and inserting Deputy Director of the Government Publishing Office; and
in the heading for each of sections 302 and 303, by striking Deputy Public Printer and inserting Deputy Director of the Government Publishing Office.

subsection.text: Any reference in any law other than in title 44, United States Code, or in any rule, regulation, certificate, directive, instruction, or other official paper in force on the date of enactment of this Act to the Deputy Public Printer shall be considered to refer and apply to the Deputy Director of the Government Publishing Office.

section.text: Section 301 of title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking , who must be a practical printer and versed in the art of bookbinding,; and
in the second sentence, by striking His and inserting The.

section.text: Section 302 of title 44, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking , who must be a practical printer and versed in the art of bookbinding,; and

subparagraph.text: by striking He and inserting The Deputy Director of the Government Publishing Office;
by striking perform the duties formerly required of the chief clerk,;
by striking , and perform and inserting and perform; and

section.text: Chapter 3 of title 44, United States Code is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence of section 304, by striking or his and inserting or the Director's;

subparagraph.text: by striking he considers and inserting the Director considers; and
by striking He may not and inserting The Director of the Government Publishing Office may not;

paragraph.text: in section 306, by striking his direction and inserting the direction of the Director;

clause.text: by striking his accounts and inserting the accounts of the disbursing officer; and
by striking his name and inserting the name of the disbursing officer;
by striking his estate and inserting the estate of the disbursing officer;
by striking to him and inserting to the deputy disbursing officer; and
by striking his service and inserting the service of the deputy disbursing officer; and
by striking by him and inserting by such officer or employee;
by striking his discretion and inserting the discretion of the Comptroller General; and
by striking whenever he each place that terms appears and inserting whenever the Comptroller General;

subparagraph.text: in the second sentence of subsection (a), by striking by him and inserting by the Director; and
in subsection (f), by striking his or her discretion and inserting the discretion of the Comptroller General;

paragraph.text: in section 310, by striking his written request and inserting the written request of the Director;
in section 311(b), by striking he justifies and inserting the Director justifies;
in section 312, by striking his service and inserting the service of such officer; and
in section 317, by striking his delegate and inserting a delegate of the Director.
